page.title: 10PLACE NAMES & SETTLEMENT.
page.content:
There is evidence of settlement in pre-Roman times with earthworks on Brackenber Moor, and the Romans mined lead here. The name Murton is probably Anglo-Saxon, meaning 'moortown'. Most local place-names are, however, of Scandinavian origin: fells, becks, dales and ghylls, for example.The local dialect has strong Norse associations,and the village children are 'bi-lingual'!
Brackenber Moor has tangible evidence of a different kind of settlement: the remains of army huts used during two world wars. It also has legends of ghosts.
